results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: The Dresden Cross Choir in its hometown = Der Dresdener Kreushor in seiner heimatstadt
results.brief_description: The Dresden Choir consists of 80 young men and boys ranging from10-20 years old and has been in existence from 156 years. Shots of the city of Dresden are interspersed with those of the Choir singing in concerts, practising and relaxing.

results.title: The Dreamlife of angels = La Vie revee des anges
results.creator_credit: Les Productions Bagheera, France 3 Cinema, Diaphana Films, Francois Marquis and Erick Zonca
results.brief_description: Erick Zonca’s feature film debut is a subtle, unflinching, yet compassionate look at the relationship between two young women - Isa (Elodie Bouchez) and Marie (Natacha Regnier), who meet while working as machinists in Lille. The two are diametrically different in appearance, attitude towards life, family and friends, and most significantly in relation towards men and Sandrine; a comatose young girl (Sandrine’s mother owns the flat that Isa and Marie are minding). There are moments of real happiness between the two, and the initial stages of their friendship as it develops is captured beautifully, allowing the viewer to absorb the expressions of each girl and speculate about character development. Their paths soon begin to diverge however - unbalancing their friendship, when Marie becomes involved in a self destructive relationship with night club owner Chris (Gregoire Colin), and Isa starts to visit Sandrine after finding the girl’s diary and becoming privy to her innermost thoughts. As the friends drift further away from one another, they are both faced with situations that challenge them and influence their future both as individuals, and as friends. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dreaming. Series 6
results.brief_description: Series six of “The Dreaming” consists of thirteen of a total of 78 short animations of Aboriginal Dreaming stories that make up the six part series. The support video accompanying series six focuses on cultural maintenance and its role in improving Aboriginal health. This rich and ambitious project was produced by Aboriginal Nations, an independent animation company committed to employing Aboriginal animators. With reference to an intellectual property protocol developed by the company, the stories were sourced from Aboriginal communities, and the permission to tell and animate them was obtained from community elders. The soundtracks utilise the voices of Aboriginal actors and feature original music by Aboriginal composers. A comprehensive teachers guide and supporting videos introducing the Dreaming and offering insights into the storytelling and animation process are also included.

results.brief_description: Series two of “The Dreaming” consists of thirteen of a total of 78 short animations of Aboriginal Dreaming stories that make up the six part series. This ambitious project was produced by Aboriginal Nations, an independent animation company committed to employing Aboriginal animators. With reference to an intellectual property protocol developed by the company, the stories were sourced from Aboriginal communities, and the permission to tell and animate them was obtained from community elders. The soundtracks utilise the voices of Aboriginal actors and feature original music by Aboriginal composers. A comprehensive teachers guide and supporting videos introducing the Dreaming and offering insights into the storytelling and animation process are also included.

results.title: The Dreaming reels. Vol. 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Volume II of a two volume set compiled by the National Film and Sound Archive (now ScreenSound Australia) containing a selection of silent Australian films, both factual and fictional, that focus on representations of Aboriginal peoples. This volume contains two feature length documentaries. “Coorab in the Island of ghosts” is believed to have been made from ethnographic footage shot on an early expedition by adventurer and overlander Francis Birtles. The material was edited and narrative intertitles added to give a ‘docudrama’ style, white interpretation of the life and tribal activities of an Aboriginal named Coorab, who lived around Cape York in Northern Australia. Despite its patronising tone the film presents a vivid picture of Aboriginal tribal life. “The Native problem in Queensland” is a silent documentary that was made for the Queensland Government which shows traditional tribal life and State institutions. It discusses the Government’s policy towards the native peoples of the state and is an official record of patrols to Queensland and Torres Strait reserves and missions by the Hon. E.M. Hanlon, Minister for Health and Home Affairs.
